column8: Rationale
High-density urban area with a younger demographic; mix of rental and owned properties.
Affluent suburban area with a high percentage of families and homeowners.
Immediate vicinity of the firm. Dense urban/suburban mix with a diverse population.
Thriving, affluent borough with a strong family demographic and historic appeal.
Well-established borough with a steady population, serving as a hub for northern Lancaster County.
Small town atmosphere surrounded by significant agricultural areas; strong community ties.
Growing borough with good rail access and increasing family-friendly residential developments.
Historic river town with high population density and ongoing revitalization efforts.
College town with a stable residential community and excellent highway access.
Agricultural hub with a strong manufacturing base and traditional values.
Northern Lancaster County location with easy turnpike access; mix of residential and rural.
Suburban area anchored by Millersville University; mix of transient and long-term residents.
Growing suburban community south of the city, popular with retirees and families.
Suburban/rural mix with a strong industrial and agricultural base; close to 17601.
The "Southern End" hub; rural/agricultural focus with a distinct community identity.
Historic river town with a mix of tourism, local business, and residential living.
Small, convenient borough located between Lancaster and Columbia; family-oriented.
Affluent residential community, part of the coveted Hempfield area; high homeownership.
Rural residential area, often serving as a bedroom community for Ephrata and Denver.
Quiet, rural area on the northern edge of the county close to the Berks County line.
